intro: Pentacalia pachypoda, commonly known as the thick-stemmed pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features thick, fleshy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Pentacalia pachypoda is adapted to grow in rocky or coastal environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
